channel.title: Tag1 on Joshua Rasband's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Tag1 on Joshua Rasband's blog

item.title: My first post
item.author: contact@jrasband.com (Joshua Rasband)
item.description:
This is my post body. \(\frac{1}{N}\sum^{n}_{i=1}\sigma_{i}^{2} = \sigma^2\)

LaTeX formatted equation: \( E = -J \sum_{i=1}^N s_i s_{i+1 }\)

\begin{equation} \label{eq:1} C = W\log_{2} (1+\mathrm{SNR}) \end{equation}

1If $a^2=b$ and \( b=2 \), then the solution must be either
2$$ a=+\sqrt{2} $$ or \[ a=-\sqrt{2} \]

If \(a^2=b\) and \( b=2 \), then the solution must be either \[ a=+\sqrt{2} \] or \[ a=-\sqrt{2} \]
item.content:encoded:
This is my post body. \(\frac{1}{N}\sum^{n}_{i=1}\sigma_{i}^{2} = \sigma^2\)

LaTeX formatted equation: \( E = -J \sum_{i=1}^N s_i s_{i+1 }\)

\begin{equation} \label{eq:1} C = W\log_{2} (1+\mathrm{SNR}) \end{equation}

1If $a^2=b$ and \( b=2 \), then the solution must be either
2$$ a=+\sqrt{2} $$ or \[ a=-\sqrt{2} \]

If \(a^2=b\) and \( b=2 \), then the solution must be either \[ a=+\sqrt{2} \] or \[ a=-\sqrt{2} \]
